output_questions.question:
What does this code render? ```html
Hello World
```
output_questions.explanation: <div> is a block-level element (starts on a new line), while <span> is an inline element (does not start a new line). Both texts are displayed in sequence.

output_questions.question:
What is the output of this HTML? ```html

This is bold and italic.

```
output_questions.output: This is bold and italic. (The word 'bold' is bold, and 'italic' is italicized.)
output_questions.explanation: The <b> and <i> tags are inline elements that style text but do not break the flow or start new lines.

output_questions.question:
What is displayed? ```html

This is a red word.

```
output_questions.output: This is a red word. (Only 'red word' is colored red.)
output_questions.explanation: <span> is an inline element. The style only applies to the text inside the span.

 ```
